definition: Zhong Yao (151-230), minister of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4] and noted calligrapher, said to have developed the regular script 楷書|楷书[kai3 shu1]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
surname Zhong
variant of 鍾|钟[zhong1]
cause/means
folk-song/forced labor
interpretations of the trigrams

sentences.english: Emperor Xian commanded Zhong Yao to draft the edict confirming Cao Cao’s elevation to king of Wei.
sentences.chinese: 獻帝即令鍾繇草詔，冊立曹操爲魏王。

sentences.english: Wei Cao Pi had in the Chung Yeung chrysanthemum to giveZhong Yao, to wish him a long.
sentences.chinese: 魏時曹丕曾在重陽贈菊給鍾繇，祝他長壽。

definition: Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
letter/also written 書札|书札
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
calligraphic style of Liu Gongquan
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic

History of Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4] or Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], sixth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Shen Yue 沈約|沈约[Shen2 Yue4] in 488 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 100 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋史[Song4 shi3])
to reward and promote
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray

Prime tortoise of the record bureau, Song dynasty historical encyclopedia of political essays, autobiography, memorials and decrees, compiled 1005-1013 under Wang Qinruo 王欽若|王钦若 and Yang Yi 楊億|杨亿, 1000 scrolls
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
great calligraphy master/the Sage of Calligraphy, traditional reference to Wang Xizhi 王羲之[Wang2 Xi1 zhi1] (303-361)
